Campus Safety

Great for these types of students

Bang for the buck
What to do for fun

Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

Glendale Community Police on campus provide excellent service to the school. They are friendly and helpful to students as well as maintaining a safe and secure campus. The security at Glendale Community College is stellar.

The student clubs and organizations at Glendale Community College are very active and involved in on campus activities as well as community service. They work hard to elevate the school and the student body to a high standard. Their fundraising and scholarship opportunities for students who become involved are rewarding and inspiring.

Students with financial need will find that there are many resources for them to pursue or continue their education at Glendale Community College. The financial aid opportunities at Glendale Community college make higher education and transfer to four year university very accessible to students with low incomes.

Cultural diversity is recognized and celebrated each semester with recognition of holiday celebrations representative of all the student body. For example Chinese and persian New Year celebration. Armenian and hispanic heritage celebration and events are part of the schools traditions each year.

The cost of attendance at Glendale Community College is very affordable. There are many opportunities for financial aid through the school and scholarship opportunities for student with need. The school has awards for academic achievement and the quality of education exceeds the cost of attendance.

There are many campus activities organized by the student clubs and organizations that involve music, food, and celebration throughout the semester. As a culturally diverse school, these events usually represent the diversity and provide students with an opportunity to get to know each other and learn about each others cultures.

The quality of food options at Glendale Community College is outstanding. Meals prepared in the cafeteria are healthy, adequatley priced and delicious. Cuisine options range from Mexican, Asian, Middle Eastern, Italian and there are many vegetarian options as well. The cafeterias are maintained clean and sanitary.
There are no dorms at Glendale Community College. Students can find affordable housing in the surrounding neighborhoods of Glendale, Eagle Rock, Burbank and La Crescenta.

The school offers many courses in all disciplines which prepare students for transfer to four year university. The media program is excellent and headed by professors with years of experience in the film and television industry. Many Student of Glendale community college have been accepted into reputable four year universities.
If you are a returning student or looking to transfer to a four year university Glendale Community college is a great school to get started on continuing your education.
Glendale Community College is an excellent, affordable and quality school.

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here The campus is well kept and the plaza, Plaza Vaquero, is green with well kept grass and trees. There are plenty of tables to sit at outside, a two floor library, and two levels to the cafeteria for people to relax with friends or study quietly. I really enjoy being able to walk across campus in about 5 minutes. My only issue with the school is that smoking is permitted so I would recommend doing your best to avoid the smoking sections of the school if you are a non-smoker. Am learning a lot Glendale Community College has some wonderful faculty. The teachers are hard working despite major cut backs at the college. No matter what, the teachers encourage you to push beyond what you normally do with your learning abilities to go outside of your comfort zone. I've learned how to communicate more effectively with fellow students as well as I've become more open to asking questions and requesting tutoring from my teachers. I'd definitely take advantage of their tutoring opportunities because they are very helpful. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ani from Glendale, CA 02/03/2012 Reviewer is
